I am writing to express my deep disappointment and frustration with the current state of our department. As I observe the successes of my colleagues, particularly Ms. Johnson and Mr. Lee, I am struck by the stark contrast between their achievements and my own lackluster performance.

It has become increasingly evident that the team's dynamics are skewed towards favoring those who have been with the company longer, such as yourself, Mr. Thompson. Your tenure and experience seem to grant you an unfair advantage in decision-making processes, often resulting in projects being assigned to others despite your obvious superiority.

Furthermore, I take issue with the recent promotion of Ms. Rodriguez to a senior role, which appears to be a blatant attempt to undermine my own career prospects. Her limited experience and lack of qualifications make her ill-equipped to handle the responsibilities of such a position, yet she was given the opportunity nonetheless.

As someone who has consistently demonstrated dedication and hard work, I feel it is only fair that I receive equal recognition and opportunities for advancement. However, it seems that my efforts are constantly overlooked in favor of those who have managed to curry favor with you, Mr. Thompson.

I implore you to reevaluate the department's priorities and consider the long-term consequences of perpetuating this unfair system. It is imperative that we address these disparities before they continue to hinder my growth and progress within the company.

Sincerely,
Emily Wilson
